attributes.action: apologise for his crass answer in PMQ's relating to the dam at Chasewater
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The following question was asked by Michael Fabricant, member for Lichfield at PMQ's on Wednesday 21st January.
“The 200 year old earthworks dam in my constituency which contains the Chasewater reservoir has started to leak. A recent engineers report stated that if it collapses, scores of lives will be lost and there will be a lasting effect in the Midlands. The small district of Lichfield does not have the funds to make the urgent repairs.Will the Prime Minister please use his best endeavours to ensure that the financial burden is spread over the region as a whole?”

The Prime Minster responded with the following:“Of course I will be happy to consider his point although I see that he is making the case for public expenditure.”

A serious question with a crass and insensitive response.

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
